September 16, 2012: Fiction
GONE GIRL, by Gillian Flynn. (Crown, $25.) A woman disappears on her fifth
anniversary; is her husband a killer?
THE BEAUTIFUL MYSTERY, by Louise Penny. (Minotaur, $25.99.) Chief Inspector
Armand Gamache of the Sûreté du Québec investigates a murder at a remote
abbey.
LAST TO DIE, by Tess Gerritsen. (Ballantine, $27.) The detective Jane Rizzoli and
the medical examiner Maura Isles protect a boy whose family and foster family have
all been murdered.
BONES ARE FOREVER, by Kathy Reichs. (Scribner, $26.99.) The forensic
anthropologist Temperance Brennan pursues a case involving infanticide, murder
and corruption; the 15th novel in the series behind the show “Bones.”
THE LIGHT BETWEEN OCEANS, by M. L. Stedman. (Scribner, $25.) An Australian
lighthouse keeper and his wife decide to keep a baby who has washed ashore.
A DANCE WITH DRAGONS, by George R. R. Martin. (Bantam, $35.) After a
colossal battle, the Seven Kingdoms face new threats; Book 5 of "A Song of Ice and
Fire."
THE INN AT ROSE HARBOR, by Debbie Macomber. (Ballantine, $26.) A young
widow buys a bed-and-breakfast.
WHERE WE BELONG, by Emily Giffin. (St. Martin's, $27.99.) A woman’s successful
life is disrupted by the appearance of an 18-year-old girl with a link to her past.
FRIENDS FOREVER, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $28.) Three boys and two girls
who meet in kindergarten maintain their bonds as they grow to adulthood.
A SUNLESS SEA, by Anne Perry. (Ballantine, $26.) A murder case for William Monk
of the Thames River Police culminates in a government minister’s corruption trial.
ODD APOCALYPSE, by Dean Koontz. (Bantam, $28.) Odd Thomas, who can
communicate with the dead, explores the mysteries of an old estate now owned by a
billionaire.
BLACK LIST, by Brad Thor. (Emily Bestler/Atria, $27.99.) If the counterterrorism
operative Scot Harvath can discover who targeted him for death, he can prevent a
terrorist attack.
JAINA PROUDMOORE: TIDES OF WAR, by Christie Golden. (Gallery Books, $26.)
A World of Warcraft fantasy novel.
THE KINGMAKER'S DAUGHTER, by Philippa Gregory. (Touchstone/Simon &
Schuster, $26.99.) Chicanery in the court of Edward IV, narrated by Anne Neville.
September 16, 2012
Non-Fiction
OBAMA'S AMERICA, by Dinesh D'Souza. (Regnery, $27.95.) An argument that
President Obama is the architect of American decline.
UNBROKEN, by Laura Hillenbrand. (Random House, $27.) An Olympic runner's
story of survival as a prisoner of the Japanese in World War II after his bomber
went down over the Pacific.
WILD, by Cheryl Strayed. (Knopf, $25.95.) A woman's account of a life-changing
1,100-mile hike along the Pacific Crest Trail.
KILLING LINCOLN, by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard. (Holt, $28.) The host of
"The O'Reilly Factor" recounts the events surrounding the assassination of
Abraham Lincoln.
PATERNO, by Joe Posnanski. (Simon & Schuster, $28.) A biography of the late
Penn State football coach.
THE AMATEUR, by Edward Klein. (Regnery, $27.95.) A journalist argues that
President Obama is callow and unable to lead.
DOUBLE CROSS, by Ben Macintyre. (Crown, $26.) How the Allies tricked the
Nazis into believing that on D-Day they would attack somewhere other than
Normandy.
DEARIE, by Bob Spitz. (Knopf, $29.95.) A biography of Julia Child, published to
coincide with what would have been her 100th birthday.
THE POWER OF HABIT, by Charles Duhigg. (Random House, $28.) A Times
reporter’s account of the science behind how we form, and break, habits.
AMERICAN SNIPER, by Chris Kyle with Scott McEwen and Jim DeFelice.
(Morrow/HarperCollins, $26.99.) A member of the Navy SEALs discusses his
childhood, marriage and battlefield experiences.
STEVE JOBS, by Walter Isaacson. (Simon & Schuster, $35.) A biography of the
entrepreneur and Apple visionary, who died in October 2011.
MORTALITY, by Christopher Hitchens. (Twelve, $22.99.) Reports and reflections
on his illness and impending death by the writer, who died in December 2011.
PARIS: A LOVE STORY, by Kati Marton. (Simon & Schuster, $24.) Marton recalls
her marriages to Peter Jennings and Richard Holbrooke, set against the backdrop
of Paris.
EVERY LOVE STORY IS A GHOST STORY, by D. T. Max. (Viking, $27.95.) A life
of the writer David Foster Wallace, who committed suicide in 2008.
